skill.name: adaptyv
skill.description: Cloud laboratory platform for automated protein testing and validation. Use when designing proteins and needing experimental validation including binding assays, expression testing, thermostability measurements, enzyme activity assays, or protein sequence optimization. Also use for submitting experiments via API, tracking experiment status, downloading results, optimizing protein sequences for better expression using computational tools (NetSolP, SoluProt, SolubleMPNN, ESM), or managing protein design workflows with wet-lab validation.
skill.summary: Cloud laboratory platform for automated protein testing and validation. Use when designing proteins ...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing code examples for API integration with Adaptyv cloud laboratory platform. No executable scripts, no file system access beyond user project, no concerning network behavior. All network calls go to legitimate Adaptyv API endpoint with standard API key authentication.

content.user_title: Test protein sequences with cloud laboratory
content.value_statement: Protein engineering requires experimental validation that most labs cannot access. Adaptyv provides automated wet-lab testing for protein sequences including binding assays, expression testing, thermostability, and enzyme activity with results in about 21 days.
actual_capabilities: Submit protein sequences for binding assays via API
Track experiment status and download results programmatically
Run expression testing across multiple host systems
Measure thermostability using DSF and circular dichroism
Assess enzyme activity with kinetic parameter determination
Integrate with computational optimization tools like SolubleMPNN and ESM
limitations: Platform is in alpha/beta phase with features subject to change
Results typically require 21 days turnaround time
API access requires separate registration and approval
Custom targets may require additional time and cost

use_cases.title: Antibody affinity maturation
use_cases.description: Screen antibody variants for binding affinity against target antigens using BLI assays

use_cases.title: Expression optimization
use_cases.description: Test protein variants in different expression systems to select highest-yield candidates

use_cases.title: AI design validation
use_cases.description: Bridge computational protein design with experimental validation in automated wet-lab workflows

prompt_templates.title: Submit binding assay
prompt_templates.prompt: Submit these antibody sequences to Adaptyv for binding assay against Human PD-L1 target. Use the API to check experiment status periodically. Format sequences in FASTA and retrieve results when complete.

prompt_templates.title: Screen expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Submit 20 protein variants to Adaptyv for expression testing in E. coli. Parse results to identify top 5 variants by yield and soluble fraction. Export results to CSV.

prompt_templates.title: Thermostability analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Submit these enzyme variants for thermostability testing. Compare melting temperatures and identify variants with improved thermal stability. Generate summary comparison table.

prompt_templates.title: Complete workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a complete protein engineering workflow: (1) optimize initial sequences with SolubleMPNN, (2) submit top candidates to Adaptyv for expression testing, (3) download and parse results, (4) identify best performers for next design round

output_examples.input: Submit these 10 protein sequences to Adaptyv for binding assay against the target and report the results
output: Top binder identified: variant_7 with KD = 2.1 nM
Results include kon, koff, KD values with confidence metrics

best_practices: Pre-screen sequences with computational tools like NetSolP or SolubleMPNN before experimental submission to reduce costs
Include wild-type or reference controls in every batch submission for benchmark comparison
Use webhook notifications instead of polling to track experiment completion efficiently
anti_patterns: Submitting sequences without computational pre-screening wastes credits on obviously problematic variants
Not including controls makes it difficult to interpret results against known benchmarks
Using polling instead of webhooks adds unnecessary API calls and delays notification

faq.question: Which AI tools are compatible with this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for protein engineering workflows and API integration.

faq.question: What is the typical turnaround time for results?
faq.answer: Most experiments complete in approximately 21 days from submission to results delivery.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing protein design pipeline?
faq.answer: Use the Python API examples to submit sequences and download results programmatically, then feed experimental data back into your design loop.

faq.question: Is my protein sequence data kept confidential?
faq.answer: Adaptyv processes sequences securely. Review their privacy policy for specific data handling practices.

faq.question: Why are my expression results lower than expected?
faq.answer: Check sequence quality, consider solubility optimization tools like SolubleMPNN, and ensure proper controls were included for comparison.

faq.question: How does this compare to traditional wet-lab testing?
faq.answer: Adaptyv provides automated, high-throughput experimental validation without requiring physical lab access, enabling rapid iteration cycles.
